A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I agree with a lot of fans that this was a disappointment\, partly because it was so hyped by the critics.  I walked out of the theater with a viscerally negative reaction.  I'd put the film somewhere between Phantom Menace and Revenge of the Sith\, although it is much more epic and visually spectacular.  I was much more bothered this time that the film was a mishmash of old plot lines and scenes than I was after watching The Force Awakens.  I didn't like most of the characters\, including a really pathetic Luke\, Snoke (decrepit old man in a robe with a menacing voice) who just gets killed off without a backstory\, Leia who just sits around looking worried the entire movie or in a coma and talks with a speech impediment\, the Benicio del Toro character whom I thought was completely unconvincing\, and Finn and Rose (the token Asian cast member) who go off on a meaningless adventure.
